text: I am relatively new to the Python language and encountered this in doing the following:

code:
__add__(...)
|      x.__add__(y) <==> x+y
|  
|  __contains__(...)
|      x.__contains__(y) <==> y in x
|  
|  __delitem__(...)
|      x.__delitem__(y) <==> del x[y]

text: Regarding these, what are the underscores for?
Because they aren't used (to my knowledge) when you use a method normally, I'm struggling to understand why they'd take the time to write them out with underscores in the documentation.
